This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ABER.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-27T11:17:26Z Victoria Higham 2015-02-27T11:05:14+00:00 2015-02-27T11:05:14+00:00 Atmospheres Conference, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - REGISTRATION NOW OPEN https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;31586f05.1502 Registration is now open for our forthcoming Atmospheres Conference.<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in 'capturing' them.<br>In this major conference celebrating the 10th anniversary of the Morgan Centre, we will be using the theme of 'atmospheres' as our starting point for interdisciplinary dialogue. [...] Nick 2015-02-09T19:41:02+00:00 2015-02-09T19:41:02+00:00 Austerity, Education and Forum Theatre - a new short blog https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;3df95bf8.1502 Dear friends and colleagues,<br><br>I thought you might be interested to read this new, short blog: 'Three blind mice and the elephant in the room: Why austerity matters to education and how forum theatre can help' (https://ioepress.co.uk/2015/02/09/three-blind-mice-and-the-elephant-in-the-room-why-austerity-matters-to-education-and-how-forum-theatre-can-help/).<br><br>The blog looks at what forum theatre can do to support children and their families in times of austerity (and other pertinent issues). [...] Nick 2015-02-01T13:30:51+00:00 2015-02-01T13:30:51+00:00 New resource (and some FREE half day workshop places!) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;6a8d7dfa.1502 Dear Friends and Colleagues,<br><br>I would like to draw your attention to a new resource available now, Forum Theatre for Children: Enhancing social, emotional and creative development, published by Trentham Books@ IOE Press (http://ioepress.co.uk/books/drama-and-film/forum-theatre-for-children-and-young-people)<br><br>Synopsis: Forum Theatre for Children shows the vital role of drama and play for children in primary as well as secondary schools, and describes each step of the process of Forum Theatre - the activities, workshops and performances. It provides detailed, evidence-based models of FT that have helped children to manage in times of austerity, family instability, community conflict and at times of transition. The book [...] Asun L\ufffd\ufffdpez-Varela 2015-01-29T19:44:43+00:00 2015-01-29T19:44:43+00:00 synesthesia, cross modality and transmedial studies https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;2df6c2ab.1501 I have not been able to attend the HERA matchmaking event in Tallinn, but I would be interested in teaming up with groups who would like to research on the topic of "synesthesia, cross modality and transmedial studies"<br>For more information, please visit the website of the research program I founded in Spain http://www.ucm.es/siim<br>See also my profile at http://www.ucm.es/siim/asun-lopez-varela<br>Many thanks Alice Clough 2015-01-27T17:00:06+00:00 2015-01-27T17:00:06+00:00 Call for papers - practice-led research and ways of learning https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;a0c87e83.1501 Hi there, I hope this call for papers might interest some of the people in this network. MeCCSA is a postgraduate journal, covering a broad range of disciplines across media, communication and cultural studies.<br><br>Call for Papers: Networking Knowledge, Journal of the MeCCSA Postgraduate network<br><br>Make, Mistake, Journey: Practice-led Research and Ways of Learning [...] monica oprescu 2015-01-14T15:41:03+02:00 2015-01-14T15:41:03+02:00 Education&Culture conference Timisoara https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;229164eb.1501 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>Due to increasing demand, the deadline for abstract submission for the<br>*International<br>Conference Beliefs and Behaviours in Education and Culture* (West<br>University of Timi\ufffd\ufffdoara, Romania, 25-27 June 2015) has been extended to *20<br>February 2015*.<br><br>The aim of the conference, proposing interdisciplinary perspectives, is to<br>build comprehensive and holistic explanations of beliefs from different<br>sciences that have a great impact upon education and culture. The<br>conference addresses themes related to issues and processes of education at<br>any level, from kindergarten to lifelong learning, from formal to informal<br>education. [...] Victoria Higham 2014-12-08T14:27:59+00:00 2014-12-08T14:27:59+00:00 Atmospheres Conference, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - CALL FOR ABSTRACTS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;21d470c7.1412 News from the Morgan Centre for Research into Everyday Lives, University of Manchester<br>Atmospheres, 1-2 July 2015, Call for Abstracts<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcapturing\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd them. [...] <> 2014-11-27T18:35:50-05:00 2014-11-27T18:35:50-05:00 Call For Presentations https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;17bc770f.1411 Dear e-mail list owner,<br><br>I'm writing to you on behalf of Semiofest to call for presentation.<br>Semiofest is the go to event for anyone interested in applied semiotics.<br>Semiotics practitioners, designers, researchers, buyers, communicators,<br>planners come and share their work. The conference is focused on sharing of<br>ideas in an accessible and inclusive fashion with the idea of letting<br>everyone in on the discussion. The conference invites 500 word abstracts.<br>http://2015.semiofest.com/?page_id=127 [...] Mal Williamson 2014-11-19T21:24:46+00:00 2014-11-19T21:24:46+00:00 neurocreator Journal - neuroscience + art + coaching + media + creative industries... https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;8ac0663d.1411 *apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Hello Creators,<br><br>the inaugural journal of Neurocreator introduces a different way of looking<br>at how creators do what we do.<br><br>From the traditions of general semantics, neuro-linguistics, changework<br>therapies and the latest explorations of neuroscience comes an approach<br>that is already transforming creators' lives.<br><br>For instance, the concepts of inspiration and the muse are based on very<br>old ideas - such as the belief system of the Roman Empire and their gods!<br>Surely in the 21st Century we can get closer to the reality of the creative<br>process? [...] Nick 2014-11-19T21:20:32+00:00 2014-11-19T21:20:32+00:00 Forum Theatre for Children - NEW RESOURCE AND FREE TRAINING https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;f5fde01b.1411 Dear Friends and Colleagues,<br><br>You are invited to attend a free training and networking day at London\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Institute of Education on developing Forum Theatre in your setting.<br><br>To celebrate the release of the book, Forum Theatre for Children: Enhancing social, emotional and creative development, by Nick Hammond, to be published by Trentham Books@ IOE Press early next year, the author, is running a series of FREE training workshops for professionals and students on: [...] monica oprescu 2014-11-06T11:34:39+01:00 2014-11-06T11:34:39+01:00 Education conference Romania 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;b180b5ca.1411 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>The Teacher Training Department, West University of Timi\ufffd\ufffdoara (Romania), is<br>pleased to announce the International Conference *Beliefs and Behaviours in<br>Education and Culture*, which<br><br>will be held in June 25 - 27, 2015.<br><br>The aim of the conference, proposing interdisciplinary perspectives, is to<br>build comprehensive and holistic explanations of beliefs from different<br>sciences that have a great impact upon education and culture. The<br>conference addresses themes related to issues and processes of education at<br>any level, from kindergarten to lifelong learning, from formal to informal<br>education. Here is my command:<br><br>fsl5.0-oxford_asl -i diffdata -o ex1_3 --tis 2.9 --bolus 1.4 --casl -c calib.<br><br>The Tag-control substraction and Kinetic model inversion seems ok. Any solutions for this problem?<br><br>Best regards,<br>Yawu<br><br>OXFORD_ASL - running<br>Pre-processing<br>Cannot open volume /tmp/fsl_PFvKws_ox_asl/calib for reading! Kester, Gary Anderson (The Institute for the Art & Practice of Dissent at Home), Fucking Good Art, Janna Graham (The Centre for Possible Studies) Rachel Marsden, John Newling, and Lorena Rivero de Beer. Thanks.<br><br>https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/7C7HV75 Heather Connelly 2014-05-12T20:40:32+01:00 2014-05-12T20:40:32+01:00 Call for proposals: In Dialogue symposium October 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;e34fbdd6.1405 Apologies for cross posting<br><br>In Dialogue, 2-4 October 2014<br>An International Symposium that interrogates how artists and researchers use dialogue in practice<br><br>In Dialogue 2014 is a series of interdisciplinary events including presentations, discussions, communal meals, open mic sessions, live music and performance/live art showcases taking place across Nottingham. Our aim is to create a dialogue between the different applications and understandings of the term 'In Dialogue', considering differences, commonalities, and how diverse approaches to understanding and articulating the theme can lead to new ways of thinking and making. [...] Anthony Hughes 2014-05-09T12:26:15+00:00 2014-05-09T12:26:15+00:00 Re: Creative Citizens: The Conference. 18 & 19 September 2014 Royal College of Art, London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;fa37c92e.1405 Hi Dave,<br>Hope you are well.<br><br>Thanks for the link, interesting event. I think I will be going to both days.<br><br>Best Wishes<br><br>Anthony<br><br>Anthony Hughes<br>Smart Culture - Project Manager<br><br>Digital Humanities Hub<br>ERI European Research Institute<br>University Of Birmingham<br>G3, Pritchatt\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Road<br>Edgbaston<br>Birmingham B15 2TT<br>E: a.hughes@bham.ac.uk<mailto:a.hughes@bham.ac.uk><br>T: 0121 414 9199<br>M.(+44) 7964 533 918<br>W: www.birmingham.ac.uk/hclh<http://www.birmingham.ac.uk/facilities/hclh/index.aspx><br><br>[logo_smart_culture small for email sig][fp7 eu logo small for emailjpg] [...] Dave Harte 2014-05-09T11:27:17+01:00 2014-05-09T11:27:17+01:00 Creative Citizens: The Conference. 18 & 19 September 2014 Royal College of Art, London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;b949033f.1405 Creative Citizens: The Conference<br><br>18 & 19 September 2014. Royal College of Art, London<br><br>Who are today\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Creative Citizens? What do they do? How are they changing communities? Come and debate new research at the first ever Creative Citizens Conference.<br><br>Register for this exciting programme online now<br><br>The conference will spotlight the motivations, achievements and the potential of creative citizens. Presenters will argue for the importance of creative citizens\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd contribution to civic life to social capital and to the economy. Panels will look at peer to peer creative activism, creative local networking around environmental issues, hyperlocal publishing, migrant and youth [...] Saul Hewish 2014-04-27T14:46:39+01:00 2014-04-27T14:46:39+01:00 Where Does Talent Come From? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;c319d7a5.1404 List subscribers maybe interested in the following conference which is in Birmingham in July.<br><br>Apologies in advance for any crossing posting. Heather Connelly 2014-04-25T16:26:33+01:00 2014-04-25T16:26:33+01:00 Call for proposals: In Dialogue symposium October 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ABER;bbe01ced.1404 In Dialogue, 2-4 October 2014<br>An International Symposium that interrogates how artists and researchers use dialogue in practice<br><br>In Dialogue 2014 is a series of interdisciplinary events including presentations, discussions, communal meals, open mic sessions, live music and performance/live art showcases taking place across Nottingham. Our aim is to create a dialogue between the different applications and understandings of the term 'In Dialogue', considering differences, commonalities, and how diverse approaches to understanding and articulating the theme can lead to new ways of thinking and making.
